name: Ng Tung Chai - Ng Tung River
description:
Introduction

Ng Tung Chai has the longest waterfall in Hong Kong. It is situated on the north slope of Tai Mo Shan, the highest mountain in Hong Kong

Approach

By car: Park at Ng Tung Chai Village

By MTR: Exit at Tai Po Train Station and take a taxi to Ng Tung Chai Village

From the village follow the road until you get to "Man Tak Yuen" stone gate. Then follow the path up the mountain.

Descent

The main fall can be done in two stages. The second set of anchors are on the small ledge, half way down on the left side of the falls.

Exit

After you have passed Bottom Falls hike back to the main path and return to the village.

Red tape
